questions.question: A major reason for the issuance of the Monroe Doctrine (1823) was to...

choices.answer: Discourage United States trade with Latin America
Defend the Panama Canal from Great Britain
Prevent further European colonization in the Caribbean
Provide economic aid to Latin American nations

questions.question: In announcing the Monroe Doctrine, President Monroe aimed to

choices.answer: Protect US interests in the Pacific Ocean
Block Cuban expansion in Africa
Increase US influence in European affairs
Prevent European nations from establishing new colonies

questions.question: The Supreme Court decisions in Marbury v. Madison, McCulloch v. Maryland, and Gibbons v. Ogden all resulted in:

choices.answer: development of new political parties
admission of new slave states
strengthening of the power of the federal government
expansion of the rights of corporations

questions.question: The Supreme Court case of Marbury v. Madison (1803) strengthened the power of the judicial branch by

choices.answer: denying states the right to secede from the Union
ruling that Congress has the right to create new territories
providing the president the power to declare war
granting federal courts the power to declare laws unconstitutional

questions.question: Which power regarding the federal judiciary was established in Marbury v. Madison?

choices.answer: The president appoints all federal judges.
The Congress creates lower federal courts
Members of the federal courts serve lifeterms.
Federal laws may be declared unconstitutional.

questions.question: Which statement describes an effect of the Louisiana Purchase (1803)?

choices.answer: The size of the United States was doubled.
The boundary with Mexico was finally established.
The Northwest Territory became part of the United States.
The Mississippi River became the western boundary of the United States.

questions.question: The Louisiana Purchase was supported by farmers in Ohio and Kentucky because they wanted to:

choices.answer: end conflicts with Mexico on the western frontier
gain unrestricted access to the Mississippi and the port of New Orleans
end the practice of slavery
secure an easier route for transporting products to the Pacific Coast.

questions.question: The Louisiana Purchase was important to the United States because it

choices.answer: Expanded the nation’s boundary to the Pacific Ocean
Removed the Spanish form North America
Closed the western territories to slavery
Secured control of the Mississippi River

questions.question: Manifest Destiny was first used to support

choices.answer: independence from Great Britain
westward expansion to the Pacific Ocean
effort to stop secession of Southern states
laws restricting labor activity

questions.question: Which action of Thomas Jefferson was in conflict with his belief in a strict interpretation of the Constitution?

choices.answer: protesting the impressment of United States sailors
purchasing the Louisiana Territory from France
pardoning violators of the Alien and Sedition Acts
using the United States Navy to subdue the Barbary pirates

questions.question: President George Washington made this statement in response to concerns over United States involvement in the

choices.answer: effort to end the slave trade in West Africa
struggle to open Asian ports to foreign trade
independence movements of the new Latin American nations
continuing conflict between England and France

questions.question: One reason President George Washington called for a policy of neutrality in the 1790s was to

choices.answer: improve his popularity among Federalist voters
avoid United States participation in European wars
gain support for the development of a United States navy
enforce the Treaty of Alliance with France

questions.question: What were two key precedents established by George Washington during his presidency?

choices.answer: aid to farmers and the end of the slave trade
universal male suffrage and support for political parties
foreign policy of neutrality use of presidential advisors
protective tariffs and foreign alliances during peacetime

questions.question: An example of the unwritten constitution is the

choices.answer: impeachment process
two-house legislature
presidential veto power
formation of political parties

questions.question: Which heading best completes the partial outline below?

choices.answer: Articles of Confederation
Constitutional Compromises
Jeffersonian Democracy
Unwritten Constitution

questions.question: Which presidential action is an example of the use of the unwritten constitution?

choices.answer: holding a cabinet meeting at the White House
nominating an ambassador to France
submitting a treaty to the Senate for ratification
vetoing a bill passed by Congress

questions.question: The elastic clause, the amendment process, and the unwritten constitution show that our constitution provides for:

choices.answer: popular sovereignty
equal representation
flexibility
ratification

questions.question: The unwritten constitution is best defined as the

choices.answer: amendments to the United States Constitution
powers that a Constitution reserves for the states
powers that the Constitution denies to Congress & the states
practices of government that are based on custom & tradition

questions.question: Under Chief Justice John Marshall (1801–1835), Supreme Court decisions generally upheld Alexander Hamilton’s belief that

choices.answer: a national debt would violate the economicprinciples of the Constitution
states should have more economic powerthan the federal government
the power of Congress should be greater than the power of the president
loose interpretation of Constitution could be used to increase fed power

questions.question: Which provision of the US Constitution best supports the idea expressed in this quotation?

choices.answer: eminent domain
electoral college
separation of powers
elastic clause

questions.question: This clause was used by Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton to justify

choices.answer: establishing the Bank of the United States
creating a federal postal system
sending troops to end the Whiskey Rebellion
imposing an embargo on trade with Great Britain

questions.question: Alexander Hamilton believed that creation of the Bank of the United States would help the nation’s economy by

choices.answer: providing for a stable currency
reducing tariffs on foreign imports
prohibiting foreign investment in United States businesses
loaning money to monopolies

questions.question: Disagreements between Hamilton and jeffer. over interpretation of the constitution contributed

choices.answer: impeachment of federal judges
defeat of the whiskey rebellion
formation of political parties
elimination of commerce clause

questions.question: Controversy over the establishment of the Bank of the United States  was  most associated with

choices.answer: George Washington issuing his Proclamation of Neutrality
Alexander Hamilton introducing his financial plan
John Adams signing the Alien and Sedition Acts into law
Thomas Jefferson supporting the Lewis and Clark expedition

questions.question: Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton supported the creation of the Bank of the United States because it would

choices.answer: increase the power of state banks
raise revenue to reduce the need for tariffs
help ensure the economic stability of the new nation
provide low-cost loans to farmers

questions.question: Washington’s Proclamation of Neutrality, Jefferson’s Embargo Act, and the Monroe Doctrine were all efforts to:

choices.answer: avoid political conflicts with European nations
directly support European revolutions
aid Great Britain in its war against France
promote military alliances

questions.question: During George Washington’s presidency, the authority of the federal government was strengthened by the

choices.answer: Elimination of political parties
Suppression of the Whiskey Rebellion
Formation of a military alliance with England
Establishment of a national language

questions.question: President George Washington’s leadership during the Whiskey Rebellion (1794) was important because it

choices.answer: showed the ability of the new government to enforce federal law
helped assure his reelection to a third term
forced frontier farmers to limit grain production
halted British fort construction in the Northwest

questions.question: The Kentucky & Virginia Resolutions (1798) held that states could nullify the Alien & Sedition Acts because these laws:

choices.answer: repealed the Northwest Ordinance
placed an unfair tax on whiskey made by western farmers
violated the Constitution
established limits on universal suffrage

questions.question: Which document encouraged public support for declaring independence from Great Britain?

choices.answer: Albany Plan of Union
Kentucky and Virginia Resolutions
Alien and Sedition Acts
"Common Sense"

questions.question: One result of the War of 1812 was that the United States

choices.answer: acquired French-held territory in southern Canada
maintained its independence and its territory
lost control of the Ohio River valley
gained territory from Mexico

questions.question: Why were Andrew Jackson and his supporters angry about the results of the Presidential Election of 1824?

choices.answer: The candidates did not do enough campaigning so the people were uniformed
There was a belief that widespread fraud had occurred
People who were not eligible to vote somehow managed to cast ballots
it was believed that a political deal was struck to decide the election

questions.question: The Mayflower Compact (1620) and the Virginia House of Burgesses (1619) are early examples of

choices.answer: restrictions on religious freedom
steps toward representative government
resistance to British rule
economic systems in the colonies

questions.question: During the 1790s, which factor best explains why the United States was able to stay out of foreign conflicts?

choices.answer: Europe depended on farm products from the United States
US announced the Monroe Doctrine
France and Great Britain agreed to end colonialism
The Atlantic Ocean helped the USA remain isolated from foreign threats

questions.question: One important goal of the Monroe Doctrine (1823) was to

choices.answer: reduce trade barriers between the US and African nations
establish US colonies and navalbases in the Caribbean
provide assistance to the Philippines gain independence
prevent colonial power from taking over Latin American
